value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: Period of time which should pass before attempting a kerberos relogin
value.name: Kerberos Relogin Period

value.description: The parent HDFS directory to which files should be written
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: Size of each block as written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Block Size

value.description: Amount of memory to use to buffer file contents during IO. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: IO Buffer Size

value.description: Number of times that HDFS will replicate each file. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Replication

value.description: A umask represented as an octal number which determines the permissions of files written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration dfs.umaskmode
value.name: Permissions umask

value.description: Changes the owner of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change owner
value.name: Remote Owner

value.description: Changes the group of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change group
value.name: Remote Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to HDFS for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to HDFS are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Packaging Format used to create the file
value.name: Packaging Format

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be extracted (tar/zip only)
value.name: File Filter

relationships.description: The original FlowFile is sent to this relationship when it cannot be unpacked for some reason
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile is sent to this relationship after it has been successfully unpacked
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: Unpacked FlowFiles are sent to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The input directory from which to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value. Back References may also be referenced using the Expression Language, as '$1', '$2', etc. The single-tick marks MUST be included, as these variables are not "Standard" attribute names (attribute names must be quoted unless they contain only numbers, letters, and _).
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the replacement. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored if the <Replacement Strategy> property is set to one of: Append, Prepend, Always Replace
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

Always replaces the entire line or the entire contents of the FlowFile (depending on the value of the <Evaluation Mode> property) and does not bother searching for any value. When this strategy is chosen, the <Search Value> property is ignored.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to success
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: Lines will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
allowableValues.displayName: Route to each matching Property Name
allowableValues.value: Route to each matching Property Name

allowableValues.description: Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the line to be considered a match
allowableValues.displayName: Route to 'matched' if line matches all conditions
allowableValues.value: Route to 'matched' if line matches all conditions

allowableValues.description: Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for the line to be considered a match
allowableValues.displayName: Route to 'matched' if lines matches any condition
allowableValues.value: Route to 'matched' if lines matches any condition

value.defaultValue: Route to each matching Property Name
value.description: Specifies how to determine which Relationship(s) to use when evaluating the lines of incoming text against the 'Matching Strategy' and user-defined properties.
value.name: Routing Strategy

allowableValues.description: Match lines based on whether or not the the text satisfies the given Expression Language expression. I.e., the line will match if the property value, evaluated as an Expression, returns true. The expression is able to reference FlowFile Attributes, as well as the variables 'line' (which is the text of the line to evaluate) and 'lineNo' (which is the line number being evaluated. This will be 1 for the first line, 2 for the second and so on).
Match lines based on whether the line starts with the property value
Match lines based on whether the line ends with the property value
Match lines based on whether the line contains the property value
Match lines based on whether the line equals the property value
Match lines based on whether the line exactly matches the Regular Expression that is provided as the Property value
Match lines based on whether the line contains some text that matches the Regular Expression that is provided as the Property value

value.description: Specifies how to evaluate each line of incoming text against the user-defined properties.
value.name: Matching Strategy

value.description: The Character Set in which the incoming text is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Indicates whether or not the whitespace at the beginning and end of the lines should be ignored when evaluating the line.
value.name: Ignore Leading/Trailing Whitespace

value.description: If true, capitalization will not be taken into account when comparing values. E.g., matching against 'HELLO' or 'hello' will have the same result. This property is ignored if the 'Matching Strategy' is set to 'Satisfies Expression'.
value.name: Ignore Case

value.description: Specifies a Regular Expression to evaluate against each line to determine which Group the line should be placed in. The Regular Expression must have at least one Capturing Group that defines the line's Group. If multiple Capturing Groups exist in the Regular Expression, the Group from all Capturing Groups. Two lines will not be placed into the same FlowFile unless the they both have the same value for the Group (or neither line matches the Regular Expression). For example, to group together all lines in a CSV File by the first column, we can set this value to "(.*?),.*". Two lines that have the same Group but different Relationships will never be placed into the same FlowFile.
value.name: Grouping Regular Expression

entry.value: Route to each matching Property Name

relationships.description: The original input file will be routed to this destination when the lines have been successfully routed to 1 or more relationships
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: Data that does not satisfy the required user-defined rules will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: unmatched

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file) in order to apply the regular expressions. Files larger than the specified maximum will not be fully evaluated.
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters a given capture group value can have. Any characters beyond the max will be truncated.
value.name: Maximum Capture Group Length

value.description: Indicates that two characters match only when their full canonical decompositions match.
value.name: Enable Canonical Equivalence

value.description: Indicates that two characters match even if they are in a different case. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?i).
value.name: Enable Case-insensitive Matching

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?x).
value.displayName: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
value.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: Indicates that the expression '.' should match any character, including a line terminator. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?s).
value.name: Enable DOTALL Mode

entry.key: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that Metacharacters and escape characters should be given no special meaning.
value.displayName: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern
value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that '^' and '$' should match just after and just before a line terminator or end of sequence, instead of only the begining or end of the entire input. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?m).
value.name: Enable Multiline Mode

value.description: When used with 'Enable Case-insensitive Matching', matches in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?u).
value.name: Enable Unicode-aware Case Folding

value.description: Specifies conformance with the Unicode Technical Standard #18: Unicode Regular Expression Annex C: Compatibility Properties. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?U).
value.name: Enable Unicode Predefined Character Classes

value.description: Indicates that only the ' ' line terminator is recognized in the behavior of '.', '^', and '$'. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?d).
value.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode

value.description: Indicates that Capture Group 0 should be included as an attribute. Capture Group 0 represents the entirety of the regular expression match, is typically not used, and could have considerable length.
value.name: Include Capture Group 0

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile
relationships.name: unmatched
